records.Name: Mint
records.Description__c: Mint is a herb with very fragrant, toothed leaves and tiny purple, pink, or white flowers. Used for cooking and to make tea.

records.Name: Jasmine
records.Description__c: The jasmine plant is a source of exotic fragrance in warmer climates. It is an important scent noted in perfumes, and also has herbal properties.

records.Name: Pothos
records.Description__c: Pothos is an attractive trailing vine with heart-shaped leaves that tolerates low light and minimal watering.

records.Name: Swedish Ivy
records.Description__c: Swedish Ivy is an evergreen perennial in the mint family, with a lovely, drooping growth habit that makes it ideal for hanging baskets.

records.Name: Aloe Vera
records.Description__c: Aloe is stemless or very short-stemmed with thick, greenish, fleshy leaves that fan out from the plant's central stem. Used in medicine.

records.Name: Parsley
records.Description__c: Parsley is a biennial plant with bright green, feather-like leaves that is in the same family as dill. Used for cooking.

records.Name: Monstera
records.Description__c: Monstera are species of evergreen tropical vines and shrubs. They are famous for their natural leaf-holes, which led to their nickname, Swiss Cheese Plant.

records.Name: Marantas
records.Description__c: Marantas are nicknamed prayer plants â€“ they close up their leaves at night, like hands in prayer, before opening them up again at dawn.

records.Name: Fountain Grass
records.Description__c: Named for its especially graceful spray of foliage, fountaingrass also sends out beautiful, fuzzy flower plumes in late summer.

records.Name: Black-eyed Susan
records.Description__c: Beloved by pollinators, black-eyed Susans generally bloom from June to August, often blanketing open fields with their golden-yellow beauty.
